abstract: Conference Board reports that its index of consumer confidence fell to 90.9 in July 2015, from revised 99.8 in June; result falls far short of analyst expectations and amounts to largest decline in four years.
lead_paragraph: The Conference Board’s index of consumer attitudes fell to 90.9 this month from a downwardly revised 99.8 in June.

headline.main: Consumer Confidence Drops Most in 4 Years as Jobs Dim
headline.print_headline: Consumer Confidence Drops Most in 4 Years as Jobs Dim

snippet: The Conference Board’s index of consumer attitudes fell to 90.9 this month from a downwardly revised 99.8 in June.
